Dialogue.NPCText:
Before you sits a frail woman swathed in flowing robes, her eyes unfocused, flickering with motes of dream-light. The sigil on her sash ripples as if caught between worlds.

She speaks in a voice that seems layered—many tones echo, one barely her own.

"The sky is a door, but the lock is in the mind... Who stirs the river between sleeping and waking?"
Her head tilts, as if listening to someone only she can hear.
"Do you come for answers, or for the questions that answer themselves?"

Option.text: I heard you are a seer. Can you guide me?
What do you see in your visions?
You seem... fragmented. Tell me who you were.
You seem troubled. Should I return later?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nyssa’s lips twist in a half-smile, her gaze glassy.

“I was Nyssa, dream-diver, once mindweaver to the Conclave. Meliara Whisperwind keeps my feet in this world—her voice tethers me when I stray too far.
Minax—she gnawed at my thoughts, wore my mind like a borrowed mask. Now I am patchwork—Lord British’s shadow sometimes visits my dreams, or perhaps I visit his? Our words tangle in the weave.”

Option.text: Have you spoken to Lord British?
How did Minax invade your dreams?
I wish to help Aerilon. Do you need aid?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nyssa draws a circle in the air, unfocused.

“I journeyed through Minax’s sleeping world, seeking secrets to guard Aerilon. Her dreams... devour. I returned with more minds than my own—now I am never alone. Some call me mad. Meliara calls me necessary. The Conclave calls me trouble, but keeps me close.”

Option.text: Can you offer me a task?

Dialogue.NPCText:
She laughs, the sound strange and musical.

“Regret is a tether, and I drift beyond tethers. I would do it again, or perhaps I already have… in someone else’s dream.”

Option.text: Is Minax still in your mind?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Her voice becomes sing-song, her eyes rolling back.
“I see cities in the sky, broken crystals weeping blue, a king lost to mirrors and a queen who is everywhere at once.
The Soul Watchers walk between worlds—find them, and the path will reveal itself.”
She shudders.
“Beware the voice that wears another’s face. Sometimes, I speak and it is not my own lips moving…”

Option.text: Can you give me a quest?

Dialogue.NPCText: “They are those who listen to the song beneath dreaming—their touch can untangle memory. There are few, and they walk quietly. Seek them beyond the cloud gates. They will know you by what you carry.”

Option.text: Can I carry something for you to a Soul Watcher?
Thank you. I must ponder this.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nyssa looks pained.
“Sometimes it is the voice of Lord British, sometimes Minax. Sometimes both. The memory is not mine, or is it? If you seek truth, you must find the memory that is missing—carry it to those who can heal.”

Option.text: Let me help you find your memory.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Meliara Whisperwind is guardian and friend—her patience is a harbor in the storm. She weaves sleepward songs to guide me home when I stray. Trust her more than you trust me.”

Nyssa’s tone shifts, echoing oddly regal.
“His crown is broken but not lost. He wanders the crystal maze behind the mirrors—reach the Soul Watcher, and perhaps you will hear his true call, not just echoes.”

Option.text: I will help you recover your memory.

Dialogue.NPCText: “A shard of the Gem of Immortality, hidden in the heart of dreaming. Find it, and you find the king.”

Option.text: I am ready for your task.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Her eyes blaze for a moment.
“Minax is the waking nightmare. She is everywhere that hope falters, and in every mind that fears. She touched me—marked me. Sometimes, she still whispers. Take this memory to a Soul Watcher, and perhaps you will untangle what she knotted.”

Option.text: How do I find a Soul Watcher?
I am ready for your errand.

Dialogue.NPCText: “I found too much—names that cut, memories not my own. There is a memory she fears, one hidden in me but no longer known to me. Deliver it to the Soul Watcher; they will see what I cannot.”

Option.text: This is too much for now.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nyssa’s hands tremble as she produces a shimmering orb sealed in crystal, threads of mist swirling within.
“This is the Mnemonic Sphere—my missing memory. I cannot know it, but the Soul Watchers may. Carry it beyond Aerilon’s walls, to one who bears the Soul Watcher’s mark. Only they can unlock what is locked.

Be wary. Minax’s shades may try to follow, and not all memories wish to be found.”

Option.text: I will deliver the Mnemonic Sphere.
What dangers await on this path?
I need time before I accept this task.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nyssa presses the sphere into your hands.
“The path is not straight. Sometimes the Soul Watcher is seen, sometimes only felt. If you fail, the memory may return to me twisted, or worse—become Minax’s. Guard it as you would your own mind.
Bring proof of delivery, and I will reward you… or perhaps someone else will.”

Option.text: I will not fail you, Mindweaver.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Dreams have guardians—some are memories, some are nightmares. Minax’s followers may come in waking or in sleep. The Sphere will protect you… once. Use it if shadows crowd your path.”

Option.text: Thank you. I accept the Mnemonic Sphere.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nyssa’s eyes shimmer with unshed tears.
“Some memories are caged for a reason. I locked this one away to keep Aerilon safe, or so I believe. But it pulls at me, even now. Perhaps it is the key to Lord British, or a lock for Minax. You decide which.”

Option.text: I will carry your memory to the Soul Watcher.
I will leave you to your thoughts.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Go, or stay, or dream—each is a path. I will wait. Time is a circle, after all.”

Option.text: On second thought, do you have a task for me?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nyssa stares through you, her voice quiet.

“I was not always drifting through dream and echo. I was once a prodigy of Wind. Not the Wind of today—cold and still—but a living place of inquiry and wonder.

I studied the tides of thought, the folds of memory. I built maps of minds. I helped the Azure Conclave form—though I did not follow Selara into the storm immediately.”

Option.text: What kind of maps of minds?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“I taught many of the current archmages, in dream and waking. Selara... I loved her brilliance. Corvus feared me, always. Eryndil was my student once, and then my friend—until he grew afraid of what I might uncover.”
A faint smirk curves her lips.
“It is dangerous to know too much in a city where secrets float heavier than stone.”

Her voice stills.
“She did what she believed was best. I was unraveling—thread by thread. But she chose Meliara to watch me, not to silence me. That must count for something.”

“Love takes many forms. I loved her mind, her fire. I would have followed her into the void. And perhaps I did.”
You feel a soft heat in your chest. Something awakens—an echo of unspoken memory.

Option.text: Strange... I feel that warmth too.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Not love of flesh. Love of flame. Of mind. Selara is a sun in human shape—radiant, merciless, essential.”
You feel a pulse behind your eyes. For a moment, you glimpse a vision of Selara walking on air, her robe trailing starlight.

Option.text: She still holds you in her circle.

Dialogue.NPCText: “She returned it with silence—and mercy. That was answer enough.”
“Eryndil knew how to listen. He sees everything, stores everything. But his fear made him cautious. He keeps a book of my life, bound in dream-leather. I wonder if he’ll ever finish it.”

Option.action: SendMessage:Seek the Dream Codex in the Archivist's sanctum... if it still dreams.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“It is not from beasts. It is made of memories hardened by guilt, loss, or shame. Very few can weave it. Fewer still survive after.”
You feel a shiver up your spine. One of your memories feels slightly... thinner.

“Wind grew afraid of the truth. They wanted order, silence, obedience. I wanted truth—even if it broke me.”
A flicker of flame dances across your vision. You feel a surge of clarity.
“Thoughts leave trails. Memories coil like snakes. I mapped them—not just of people, but of places, cities, even the wind itself. Aerilon dreams, you know. It remembers its own building.”

“It dreams of falling. Always. The crystals ache. They miss the ground. One day… they may stop holding.”
A chill wind passes over you though there is no breeze.
“Tell Selara. Or Salia. Or Eryndil. Or no one. If they already know, they may lie. If they don’t… then the dream will become a scream.”

Option.text: I will speak with Salia Moontide.
Option.action: SendMessage:She works by the lowest platform. Watch her hands—they tremble.
SendMessage:Bring the word 'Fracture' to Eryndil. He will understand.
